result.execSummary:
The defendant Justice L. Mercer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** 2 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justice L. Mercer

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Case called at 9:36 AM.  Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Justice L. Mercer in court.  Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Justice L. Mercer. Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives his right for the Court to appear in person.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads to Count 2: Misdemeanor Battery; Repeater; Domestic Abuse and Count 4: Disorderly Conduct; Repeater.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.  No contact with D.H. Comply with ATR.
Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is granted 2 days of sentence credit. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Conditions:
No contact with D.H. or A.V. without probation officer's prior written okay; no acts or threats of violence.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jay Heit at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 09/23/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Conditions:

(11:17 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justice L. Mercer appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Justice L. Mercer.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with D.H., A.V.
